pv3199.lib.java.util

Class Arrays

  • java.lang.Object
    • pv3199.lib.java.util.Arrays

  • public final class Arrays
extends Object
    Utilities for arrays, such as casting multi-dimensional arrays, sorting multi-dimensional arrays, finding minimum and maximum values, and cloning arrays.
    Author:
    Vishal Patel

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Arrays.RandomPrimitive
      Enumeration for generating a random primitive value (wraps into an object when the generated value is returned).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> T castArray(Object source, Class<T> newType)
      Casts an array of one type to another type of array, including primitive to wrapper and wrapper to primitive casts.
      static Object clone(Object array)
      Clones an array such that a == b returns true, where a is a bottom-most element in the original array and b is a bottom-most element in the same position as in the original array but referenced from the cloned array; however, c == d returns false, where c is not a bottom-most element in the original array and d is not a bottom-most element in the same position as in the original array as c is but referenced from the cloned array.
      static boolean contains(Object array, Object element)
      Checks whether an array contains an element.
      static <T> boolean deepEquals(T[] a, T[] b)
      Performs a deep equality search on two arrays of the same type.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static Object get(Object array,
                         int[] indices)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException,
                         ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the element located at the indices in some dimensional array. If get(array, new int[]{1, 2, 3}) is called, then it returns the equivalent of array[1][2][3].
        Parameters:
        array - - the array.
        indices - - the indices for each dimension.
        Returns:
        the element located at these indices in the array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is not actually an array
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if one of the indices is out of bounds for this array.

      • get

        public static Object get(Object array,
                         Iterator<Integer> indices)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException,
                         ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the element located at the indices in some dimensional array. If get(array, iterator) is called and array is a valid array and iterator is a valid Iterator consisting of the Integer objects 1, 2, and 3 in that order, then it virtually returns array[1][2][3].
        Parameters:
        array - - the array.
        indices - - the indices for each dimension.
        Returns:
        the element located at these indices in the array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is not actually an array
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if one of the indices is out of bounds for this array.

      • set

        public static void set(Object array,
                       int[] indices,
                       Object newValue)
                throws IllegalArgumentException,
                       ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets an element in an array to a new value. If set(array, new int[]{1, 2, 3}, null) is called and array is a valid array, then the method virtually executes array[1][2][3] = null.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array.
        indices - - the indices tracing to the array index to change.
        newValue - - the new value of the element.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is not actually an array or if the indices attempt to access an array when the
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if one of the indices is out of bounds for this array.

      • set

        public static void set(Object array,
                       Iterator<Integer> indices,
                       Object newValue)
                throws IllegalArgumentException,
                       ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets an element in an array to a new value. If set(array, iterator, null) is called and array is a valid array and iterator is a valid Iterator consisting of the Integer objects 1, 2, and 3 in that order, then the method virtually executes array[1][2][3] = null.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array.
        indices - - the indices tracing to the array index to change.
        newValue - - the new value of the element.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is not actually an array
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if one of the indices is out of bounds for this array.

      • randFillArray

        public static Object randFillArray(Object array,
                                   Arrays.RandomPrimitive generator)
                            throws ClassCastException,
                                   IllegalArgumentException
        Randomly deep fills an array with primitives or wrapper-equivalent objects. A check is performed to make sure the array can be randomly filled based on it's deepest component type and the random primitive generator provided (an exception is thrown if the check fails). For example, an int or Integer based array cannot be randomly filled using Arrays.RandomPrimitive.BOOLEAN, and vice-versa. Or even a String based array being randomly filled using Arrays.RandomPrimitive.CHAR as there is no standardized way of determining the string's length.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to randomly fill up
        generator - - the Arrays.RandomPrimitive enumeration to use when filling the array
        Returns:
        a reference to the array passed in.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if the deepest component type of the array cannot be casted from the generated Arrays.RandomPrimitive value.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array is not actually an array.

      • joinArrays

        public static <T> T[] joinArrays(T[]... arrays)
        Combines multiple arrays into one array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the data type of the arrays.
        Parameters:
        arrays - - the arrays to combine.
        Returns:
        the combined array otherwise

      • indexOf

        public static int[] indexOf(Object array,
                            Object element)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Finds the location of an element in any dimensional array through a recursive-linear approach. The deepest elements which represent the root
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to search through.
        element - - the element to look for.
        Returns:
        null if the element could not be found; otherwise an int array containing the dimension-indices for the array to lead to the element.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is not an actual array or if the component type of array is not the same as the type of the element.

      • lastIndexOf

        public static int[] lastIndexOf(Object array,
                                Object element)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Finds the last set of indices of a certain element in a given dimensional array.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to look through.
        element - - the element to find.
        Returns:
        null if the array is null, is not an array, or if the element could not be found; otherwise an int array listing the indices at which the element is located in each dimension.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is not an actual array.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(Object array,
                               Object element)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Checks whether an array contains an element.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to search through.
        element - - the element to look for.
        Returns:
        false if an IllegalArgumentException is caught or if the element is not found in the array; true otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is not an actual array.

      • max

        public static <T> Object max(Object array)
                      throws ClassCastException,
                             IllegalArgumentException
        Finds the maximum deep value in an array. The maximum value is found by comparing the deepest elements of the array (null values are ignored). The comparisons are made using the Comparable interface. As such, the generic type for a Comparable object should be the deep component type of this array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type for the Comparable interface, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to search through.
        Returns:
        the maximum deep value in the array.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if a cast error occurs when attempting to compare two elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.

      • max

        public static <T> Object max(Object array,
                             Comparator<T> comparator)
                      throws ClassCastException,
                             IllegalArgumentException
        Finds the maximum deep value in an array. The maximum value is found by comparing the deepest elements of the array (null values are ignored). The comparisons are made using the comparator provided. If the comparator is null, then the Comparable interface is utilized (see max(Object)).
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type of the comparator, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to search through.
        comparator - - the comparator used to compare the elements of the array.
        Returns:
        the maximum deep value in the array.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if a cast error occurs when attempting to compare two deep elements in the array.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the comparator is null and the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.
        See Also:
        max(Object)

      • min

        public static <T> Object min(Object array)
                      throws ClassCastException
        Finds the minimum deep value in an array. The minimum value is found by comparing the deepest elements of the array (null values are ignored). The comparisons are made using the Comparable interface. As such, the generic type for a Comparable object should be the deep component type of this array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type for the Comparable interface, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to search through.
        Returns:
        the minimum deep value in the array.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if a cast error occurs when attempting to compare two elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.

                             Comparator<T> comparator)
                      throws ClassCastException
        Finds the minimum deep value in an array. The minimum value is found by comparing the deepest elements of the array (null values are ignored). The comparisons are made using the comparator provided. If the comparator is null, then the Comparable interface is utilized (see min(Object)).
        Type Parameters:

        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the comparator is null and the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.
        See Also:
        max(Object)

      • sort

        public static <T> Object sort(Object array)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sorts an array in ascending order comparing the array's deepest elements (null values are considered to be less than any other value). The comparisons are made using the Comparable interface. As such, the generic type for a Comparable object should be the deep component type of this array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type for the Comparable interface, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to sort.
        Returns:
        the sorted array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.

      • sort

        public static <T> Object sort(Object array,
                              Comparator<T> comparator)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sorts an array in ascending order comparing the array's deepest elements (null values are considered to be less than any other value). The comparisons are made using a Comparator. As such, the generic type for the Comparator object should be the deep component type of this array. If the comparator provided is null, then the Comparable interface is utilized (see sort(Object)).
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type for the Comparator interface, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to sort.
        comparator - - the comparator to use for sorting
        Returns:
        the sorted array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the comparator is null and the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.
        See Also:
        sort(Object)

      • reverseSort

        public static <T> Object reverseSort(Object array)
        Sorts an array in descending order comparing the array's deepest elements (null values are considered to be less than any other value). The comparisons are made using the Comparable interface. As such, the generic type for a Comparable object should be the deep component type of this array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type for the Comparable interface, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to sort.
        Returns:
        the reverse-sorted array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.

      • reverseSort

        public static <T> Object reverseSort(Object array,
                                     Comparator<T> comparator)
        Sorts an array in descending order comparing the array's deepest elements (null values are considered to be less than any other value). The comparisons are made using a Comparator. As such, the generic type for the Comparator object should be the deep component type of this array. If the comparator provided is null, then the Comparable interface is utilized (see sort(Object)).
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the generic type for the Comparator interface, intended to match the array's deepest component type.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to sort.
        comparator - - the comparator to use in reverse sorting.
        Returns:
        the reverse-sorted array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object passed in is not an actual array or if the comparator is null and the array's deepest component type does not implement the Comparable interface.
        See Also:
        sort(Object)

      • castArray

        public static <T> T castArray(Object source,
                              Class<T> newType)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Casts an array of one type to another type of array, including primitive to wrapper and wrapper to primitive casts.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the type of the new array.
        Parameters:
        source - - the array to cast.
        newType - - the new data type that the array will be casted to.
        Returns:
        null if the array cannot be casted; otherwise the casted array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is not an actual array.

      • getDimensionSizes

        public static int[] getDimensionSizes(Object array)
        Gets the dimension sizes of an array object.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array object to retrieve the dimension sizes from.
        Returns:
        an int array of the array's dimension sizes.

      • clone

        public static Object clone(Object array)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Clones an array such that a == b returns true, where a is a bottom-most element in the original array and b is a bottom-most element in the same position as in the original array but referenced from the cloned array; however, c == d returns false, where c is not a bottom-most element in the original array and d is not a bottom-most element in the same position as in the original array as c is but referenced from the cloned array. In other terms, both c and d are some array object, while a and b are deep component elements.
        Parameters:
        array - - the array to clone.
        Returns:
        the cloned array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is not an actual array.

      • deepEquals

        public static <T> boolean deepEquals(T[] a,
                                     T[] b)
        Performs a deep equality search on two arrays of the same type. Checks equality of each component element through instance equality (==) and through Object.equals(Object) if instance equality fails.
        Parameters:
        a - - the first array.
        b - - the second array.
        Returns:
        true if both arrays are equal on a "deep" or raw component level.
